page.title: 02HOLIDAYS IN DURSLEY
page.content: Stouts Hill School was a Preparatory School for boys aged 8-13 years. It was founded in 1933 and its most famous ex-pupil must be Captain Mark Phillips, husband of H.R.H.Princess Anne. They live at nearby Gatcombe Park. The school closed down at Easter 1979 due to lack of pupils and the building is now used as a Time-Sharing holiday complex. Facilities available to the temporary residents include horse-riding,tennis, croquet, badminton, table tennis and snooker. Two swimming pools, one indoor and one outdoor, and a sauna are part of the scheme.
